resources.string: It is not a concussion if you don\'t black out.
Through proper equipment, coaching, better techniques, education, and positive sports culture; some concussions may be avoided.
Repeated concussions have been shown to increase the risk of developing CTE (Chronic Traumatic Encephalopathy) to an athlete.
Trying to "tough it out" with a concussions can increase the recovery time, and put you at risk for Second Impact Syndrome.
How many concussions do Oregon high school athletes experience per year?
Which of the following is not a tip for successful concussion recovery?
Which of the following is not a sign of a concussion?
Which of the following is the correct order for successful concussion management?
How many concussions does the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention estimate occur in America?
